name: n8n-nodes-base.seaTableTrigger
description: Starts the workflow when SeaTable events occur

properties.name: pollTimes
properties.description: Time at which polling should occur

values.name: mode
values.description: How often to trigger.

values.name: hour
values.description: The hour of the day to trigger (24h format)

values.name: minute
values.description: The minute of the day to trigger

values.name: dayOfMonth
values.description: The day of the month to trigger

values.name: weekday
values.description: The weekday to trigger

values.name: cronExpression
values.description:
Use custom cron expression. Values and ranges as follows:
  • Seconds: 0-59
  • Minutes: 0 - 59
  • Hours: 0 - 23
  • Day of Month: 1 - 31
  • Months: 0 - 11 (Jan - Dec)
  • Day of Week: 0 - 6 (Sun - Sat)

values.name: value
values.description: All how many X minutes/hours it should trigger

values.name: unit
values.description: If it should trigger all X minutes or hours

name: n8n-nodes-base.set
description: Sets values on items and optionally remove other values

properties.name: keepOnlySet
properties.description: Whether only the values set on this node should be kept and all others removed

properties.name: values
properties.description: The value to set

values.name: name
values.description: Name of the property to write data to. Supports dot-notation. Example: "data.person[0].name"

values.name: value
values.description: The boolean value to write in the property

values.name: name
values.description: Name of the property to write data to. Supports dot-notation. Example: "data.person[0].name"

values.name: value
values.description: The number value to write in the property

values.name: name
values.description: Name of the property to write data to. Supports dot-notation. Example: "data.person[0].name"

values.name: value
values.description: The string value to write in the property

options.name: dotNotation
options.description:
By default, dot-notation is used in property names. This means that "a.b" will set the property "b" underneath "a" so { "a": { "b": value} }.

If that is not intended this can be deactivated, it will then set { "a.b": value } instead.

.

options.description: A description of the product. Supports HTML formatting.

options.description: A unique human-friendly string for the product. Automatically generated from the product's title. Used by the Liquid templating language to refer to objects.

options.name: created_at
options.description: The date and time when the product image was created

options.name: id
options.description: A unique numeric identifier for the product image

options.name: position
options.description: The order of the product image in the list. The first product image is at position 1 and is the "main" image for the product.

options.name: product_id
options.description: The ID of the product associated with the image

options.name: variant_ids
options.description: An array of variant IDs associated with the image

options.name: src
options.description:
Specifies the location of the product image. This parameter supports URL filters that you can use to retrieve modified copies of the image.

For example, add _small, to the filename to retrieve a scaled copy of the image at 100 x 100 px (for example, ipod-nano_small.png), or add _2048x2048 to retrieve a copy of the image constrained at 2048 x 2048 px resolution (for example, ipod-nano_2048x2048.png).

.

options.name: width
options.description: Width dimension of the image which is determined on upload

options.name: height
options.description: Height dimension of the image which is determined on upload

options.name: updated_at
options.description: The date and time when the product image was last modified

options.name: productOptions
options.description: The custom product property names like Size, Color, and Material. You can add up to 3 options of up to 255 characters each.

options.name: src
options.description:
Specifies the location of the product image. This parameter supports URL filters that you can use to retrieve modified copies of the image.

For example, add _small, to the filename to retrieve a scaled copy of the image at 100 x 100 px (for example, ipod-nano_small.png), or add _2048x2048 to retrieve a copy of the image constrained at 2048 x 2048 px resolution (for example, ipod-nano_2048x2048.png).

.

options.description: The custom product property names like Size, Color, and Material. You can add up to 3 options of up to 255 characters each.

options.name: Create
options.description: Create a push notification

properties.name: content
properties.description: To provide text in a push, supply one of either "content" or "pushContent" (or both). Limited to 2500 characters. (Required if a value for "pushContent" is not provided).

options.name: channelName
options.description: The name of a channel you created. If you have not yet created a channel, simply don't provide this value and the push will be sent to your main account.

options.name: expirationStamp
options.description: A Unix timestamp. When to automatically expire your push notification. The default is 10 days after pushing. The push will become unaccessible within 15-30 minutes of the selected time, but will remain on all device screens until dismissed or clicked.

options.name: iOSDeepLink
options.description: An iOS deep link. Use this to deep link into other apps. Alternatively, you can provide a universal link in the link attribute and set openLinkInApp to false.

options.name: link
options.description: A link that can be attached to your push. Must be a valid URL.

options.name: openInHomeFeed
options.description: Whether the notification opens to the home feed or to a standalone page with the notification. The default (openInHomeFeed=False) is to open the notification on a standalone page.

options.name: openLinkInApp
options.description: Whether to open the provided link within the iOS app or in Safari. Android PWA opens all links in the default web browser.

options.name: pushToEmails
options.description:
Emails (strings) to whom to send the notification. If all three attributes 'pushToFollowers', 'pushToPhoneNumbers' and 'pushToEmails' are not supplied, then everyone who follows the channel will receive the push notification.

If 'pushToFollowers' is supplied, only those listed in the array will receive the push notification.

If one of the userIds supplied does not follow the specified channel, then that userId value will be ignored.

See the "Followers" section to learn how to list the userIds of those who follow one of your channels.

.

options.name: pushToFollowers
options.description:
User IDs (strings) to whom to send the notification. If all three attributes 'pushToFollowers', 'pushToPhoneNumbers' and 'pushToEmails' are not supplied, then everyone who follows the channel will receive the push notification.

If 'pushToFollowers' is supplied, only those listed in the array will receive the push notification.

If one of the userIds supplied does not follow the specified channel, then that userId value will be ignored.

See the "Followers" section to learn how to list the userIds of those who follow one of your channels.

.

options.name: pushToPhoneNumbers
options.description:
Phone numbers (strings) to whom to send the notification. If all three attributes 'pushToFollowers', 'pushToPhoneNumbers' and 'pushToEmails' are not supplied, then everyone who follows the channel will receive the push notification.

If 'pushToFollowers' is supplied, only those listed in the array will receive the push notification.

If one of the userIds supplied does not follow the specified channel, then that userId value will be ignored.

See the "Followers" section to learn how to list the userIds of those who follow one of your channels.

.

Emails (strings) to whom to send the notification. If all three attributes 'pushToFollowers', 'pushToPhoneNumbers' and 'pushToEmails' are not supplied, then everyone who follows the channel will receive the push notification.

If 'pushToFollowers' is supplied, only those listed in the array will receive the push notification.

If one of the userIds supplied does not follow the specified channel, then that userId value will be ignored.

See the "Followers" section to learn how to list the userIds of those who follow one of your channels.

.

options.name: pushToFollowers
options.description:
User IDs (strings) to whom to send the notification. If all three attributes 'pushToFollowers', 'pushToPhoneNumbers' and 'pushToEmails' are not supplied, then everyone who follows the channel will receive the push notification.

If 'pushToFollowers' is supplied, only those listed in the array will receive the push notification.

If one of the userIds supplied does not follow the specified channel, then that userId value will be ignored.

See the "Followers" section to learn how to list the userIds of those who follow one of your channels.

.

options.name: pushToPhoneNumbers
options.description:
Phone numbers (strings) to whom to send the notification. If all three attributes 'pushToFollowers', 'pushToPhoneNumbers' and 'pushToEmails' are not supplied, then everyone who follows the channel will receive the push notification.

If 'pushToFollowers' is supplied, only those listed in the array will receive the push notification.

If one of the userIds supplied does not follow the specified channel, then that userId value will be ignored.

See the "Followers" section to learn how to list the userIds of those who follow one of your channels.

.

options.name: schedule
options.description: A Unix timestamp. Schedule a push to be sent at a later date and time.

options.name: subtitle
options.description: The subtitle of your push. Limited to 20 characters. Only appears on iOS devices.

options.name: pushTitle
options.description: The title of push. Appears in bold at the top. Limited to 100 characters.
